member.name: T:SerousEnergyLib.Pathfinding.PriorityQueue`1
member.summary: PriorityQueue provides a stack-like interface, except that objects "pushed" in arbitrary order are "popped" in order of priority, i.e., from least to greatest as defined by the specified comparer.
member.remarks: Push and Pop are each O(log N). Pushing N objects and them popping them all is equivalent to performing a heap sort and is O(N log N).

member.name: P:SerousEnergyLib.Pathfinding.PriorityQueue`1.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of items in the priority queue.

member.name: P:SerousEnergyLib.Pathfinding.PriorityQueue`1.Top
member.summary: Gets the first or topmost object in the priority queue, which is the object with the minimum value.

member.name: M:SerousEnergyLib.Pathfinding.PriorityQueue`1.Clear
member.summary: Clears the queue and removes any values stored in it

member.name: M:SerousEnergyLib.Pathfinding.PriorityQueue`1.Push(`0)
member.summary: Adds an object to the priority queue.

member.name: M:SerousEnergyLib.Pathfinding.PriorityQueue`1.Pop
member.summary: Removes the first node (i.e., the logical root) from the heap.

member.name: M:SerousEnergyLib.Pathfinding.PriorityQueue`1.HeapParent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the parent node index given a child node's index, taking advantage of the "shape" property.

member.name: M:SerousEnergyLib.Pathfinding.PriorityQueue`1.HeapLeftChild(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the left child's index given the parent's index, taking advantage of the "shape" property. If there is no left child, the return value is >= _count.

member.name: M:SerousEnergyLib.Pathfinding.PriorityQueue`1.HeapRightFromLeft(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the right child's index from the left child's index, taking advantage of the "shape" property (i.e., sibling nodes are always adjacent). If there is no right child, the return value >= _count.

member.name: T:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.ConnectionDirection

member.name: F:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.ConnectionDirection.None
member.summary: No connections

member.name: F:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.ConnectionDirection.Up
member.summary: The tile is connected to the tlie above it

member.name: F:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.ConnectionDirection.Left
member.summary: The tile is connected to the tile to the left of it

member.name: F:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.ConnectionDirection.Right
member.summary: The tile is connected to the tile to the right of it

member.name: F:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.ConnectionDirection.Down

member.name: T:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.NetworkColor
member.summary: A set of indicators representing pathfinding exclusion

member.name: T:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.NetworkInfo
member.summary: A structure representing information for a tile

member.name: F:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.NetworkInfo.netData
member.summary:
DDDD PTTT
DDDD = connection flags (0001 = Up, 0010 = Left, 0100 = Right, 1000 = Down)
P = pump flag
TTT = pipe/wire type flags (001 = Item, 010 = Fluid, 100 = Power)

member.name: P:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.NetworkInfo.Connections
member.summary: The directions that this network tile is connected with. Due to the nature of , one tile can be connected to multiple directions at once.

member.name: P:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.NetworkInfo.IsPump
member.summary: Whether this network tile is classified as a pump. If it is, the pump direction will be derived from

member.name: P:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.NetworkInfo.Type
member.summary: The type of network(s) contained at this tile. Due to the nature of , one tile can contain all 3 of the possible network types.

member.name: T:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.NetworkTaggedInfo
member.summary: A structure representing information for a tile

member.name: F:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.NetworkTaggedInfo.tagData
member.summary:
--PP CCCC
PP = pump direction (00 = left, 01 = up, 10 = right, 11 = down)
CCCC = network color (see: )

member.name: P:SerousEnergyLib.TileData.NetworkTaggedInfo.PumpDirection
member.summary: If this network tile is a pump (see: ), this property indicates which direction its head is facing.

member.name: M:SerousEnergyLib.Tiles.IPipedItemDrawingTile.GetItemSize(System.Int32,System.Int32)

Return the max width for an item being drawn in this transport tile here.
E.g. if this method were to return 6f, then an item's sprite would be scaled down to fit within a 6x6 pixel area.

The tile Y-coordinate of the transport tile
